input_window_width.description: The width of the window. Value 0 indicates the maximum available

slices.description: Number of slices per frame. Value 0 indicates not set. Forces rectangular slices. This determines the maximum number of simultaneous encode threads that can be used.

input_window_y.description: The y coordinate of the upper left corner of the window

dash_max_dup_frac.description: Maximum duplicate frames specified as a segment fraction to add to fill gaps. Defaults to dash_max_dup if 0

annexb.description: Use Annex B byte stream format

aud.description: Include an access unit delimiter between each frame

dash_seg_size_sec.description: DASH target segment size in seconds, which will be converted into a fixed frame count. Set to 0 for intra-frame encoding, i.e. any segment size

width.description: Width of the video input in pixels

input_window_height.description: The height of the window. Value 0 indicates the maximum available

cabac.description: CABAC or CAVLC. Encode and decode both need about 2x the CPU power to use CABAC, but P2 may require it

reopen_flow_id_change.description: reopen the encoder and change the output flow id if the input flow id changes

keyint.description: Max interval (in frames) between key frames

threads.description: Number of frame or slice threads. Value 0 indicates auto.

disable_psy.description: Set psy adaptive QP to NONE and disable psy optimisations

height.description: Height of the video input in pixels

intra_8x8.description: Set the intra partitions to X264_ANALYSE_I8x8

tune.description: Tune the settings for a particular type of source or situation

sliced-threads.description: Use lower latency but lower efficiency slice threads. Overrides value set in 'tune' parameter.

offset.description: seek to offset relative to action timestamp

StrictTiming.description: if true then drop frames which miss their scheduled slot. If false then restart timing

SequenceId.description: playback the sequence with given sequence identifier (UUID)

SequenceIdArray.description: playback an array of sequences with the given identifiers (UUID)

OutputStartTsOffset.description: the output start timestamp offset relative to about 'now'

InputEndTs.description: the playback end timestamp on the input timeline

InputStartTs.description: the input start timestamp. Defaults to the timestamp of the first grain

InputDuration.description: the playback duration on the input timeline

OutputOriginTs.description: the timestamp to use as the origin for the relative output start timestamp

offset.description: seek to offset relative to action timestamp

Loop.description: loop back to the start when the end is reached

StrictLoopEndTiming.description: if StrictTiming is false then ensure that at least the loop/end timestamp is kept

RingSeqDelay.description: ring sequence playout delay. Only valid with SequenceId
